item.description:
"Seeing the film over and over again, year after year, I find it never grows over-familiar. It plays like a favorite musical album; the more I know it, the more I like it." - Roger Ebert

"Yes, indeed, the Warners here have a picture which makes the spine tingle and the heart take a leap." - Bosley Crowther, New York Times

"Across seven decades, the Humphrey Bogart-Ingrid Bergman starrer has emerged as Americans' default favorite movie." - Douglas Pratt, Hollywood Reporter

Most of you know the plot of Casablanca. In fact most of you, unlike me, have seen Casablanca.

But just in case, I'll write a brief synopsis. Casablanca is a love story set in World War II Morocco. Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Blaine, an American who runs a cafe that becomes a gathering place for everyone in the city. Rick's long lost love Ilsa (Ingrid Bergman) appears in Casablanca with her Resistance leader husband Victor, thus pulling Rick into a love triangle and a web of political intrigue. Ilsa and Victor need to get out of Casablanca and Rick is the only one who can help him. But will he?

This film is being screened as part of the Coolidge's outdoor film series. Please bring a blanket or chair to sit on and food/drink to share with the group. The film starts at 8, but I've set the meeting time to 7 so everyone can get settled and acquainted before the movie. Due to the late ending time, we will not have a post movie discussion.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll have red balloons set out next to the blanket where I'm sitting.
item.name: Casablanca Under the Stars
